overview_of_class: This is a graduate reading seminar on the intersection of race and gender in the United States. We will examine theoretical, historical, sociological, anthropological, and literary works by and about women of color, immigrants, and LGBT-identified people. The course is designed for graduate students in the humanities, social sciences and communications with research or teaching interests in race, gender, immigration or diaspora studies, or ethnic studies.
